1061.description: Ester gum, also known as glycerol ester of wood rosin, is an emulsifier and stabilizer commonly used in beverages, especially citrus-flavored sodas, to keep oils and flavorings evenly distributed.

sources.label: PubMed â Food additives overview: safety and regulatory status
ScienceDirect â Food Additives: E-numbers and functions

1061.risks: Possible gastrointestinal discomfort in high amounts, potential impurities depending on source, ultra-processed additive

656.name: Calcium Disodium EDTA
656.description: Calcium disodium EDTA is a synthetic chelating agent widely used as a preservative and stabilizer in processed foods to prevent discoloration and rancidity by binding metal ions.

sources.label: PubMed â Evaluation of toxicity and safety of calcium disodium EDTA
ScienceDirect â Toxicological profile and regulatory aspects of EDTA in food

656.risks: Possible gastrointestinal discomfort, potential disruption of mineral absorption, synthetic additive, may cause hypersensitivity reactions in rare cases

1316.name: Potassium Benzoate (Preservative)
1316.description: Potassium benzoate is a synthetic preservative used to inhibit the growth of mold, yeast, and some bacteria in acidic foods and beverages, thereby extending shelf life.

sources.label: PMC4427723 â Review on benzoic acid and related preservatives
PubMed â Safety evaluation of benzoate preservatives

1316.risks: Potential for benzene formation in presence of vitamin C, possible mild allergen, ultra-processed additive, no nutritional value

2101.name: D-Alpha-Tocopherol Acetate
2101.description: D-Alpha-Tocopherol Acetate is a synthetic ester form of vitamin E commonly used as a dietary supplement and antioxidant in food products. It is converted to the biologically active form of vitamin E in the body, supporting cellular membranes and acting as a free radical scavenger.

sources.label: PMC6164842 â The role of tocopherol and tocotrienol in cardiovascular health
PubMed â Vitamin E in human health and disease

2101.risks: Digestive upset at high doses, potential anticoagulant effect at high intake, possible interaction with anticoagulant medications
2101.benefits: Antioxidant activity, supports immune function, protects cell membranes

12408.name: Chloride
12408.description: Chloride is an essential electrolyte and mineral naturally present in many foods and often added to table salt (sodium chloride) and potassium chloride. It is critical for maintaining fluid balance, acid-base homeostasis, and proper nerve and muscle function in the human body. Chloride is recognized as Generally Recognized As Safe (GRAS) by the FDA when used in food. Deficiency or excessive intake can lead to health problems, but typical dietary intake from food sources is safe.

sources.label: NIH: Chloride Fact Sheet for Health Professionals
NCBI: Physiology, Chloride

12408.risks: High intake may contribute to hypertension when paired with sodium, rare cases of metabolic alkalosis with deficiency
12408.benefits: Maintains electrolyte balance, essential for fluid regulation, supports nerve function, aids in digestion (as a component of stomach acid)

12542.name: Sodium
12542.description: An essential electrolyte that helps regulate fluid balance and nerve function, commonly found in mineral waters as sodium bicarbonate or sodium chloride

78.name: Thallium
78.description: Thallium is a heavy metal element that is highly toxic to humans and animals, even in low concentrations. It is not used intentionally in food products and its presence is typically due to contamination.

sources.label: PubMed â Thallium toxicity: A review
PMC4493503 â Thallium Poisoning: An Overview

78.risks: Highly toxic, neurotoxicity, gastrointestinal distress, hair loss, renal failure, potential carcinogen

2021.name: Magnesium Chloride
2021.description: Magnesium chloride is a highly bioavailable magnesium salt commonly used as a mineral supplement or in fortified foods to support electrolyte balance and physiological functions such as nerve conduction, muscle contraction, and bone health.

sources.label: PubMed â Magnesium in prevention and therapy
PMC5666900 â Bioavailability of different magnesium salts

2021.risks: Gastrointestinal upset at high doses, diarrhea, potential risk in individuals with kidney dysfunction
2021.benefits: Improved magnesium status, supports nerve and muscle function, may correct magnesium deficiency

2022.name: Calcium Chloride
2022.description: Calcium chloride is a salt commonly used in food processing as a firming agent, flavor enhancer, and stabilizer. In the body, it provides a source of calcium but is not typically used for nutritional supplementation due to its high solubility and rapid dissociation.

sources.label: PubMed â Food additives and their health implications
PMC4045288 â Calcium in human health

2022.risks: Potential for gastrointestinal irritation at high intakes, excessive calcium intake if consumed with multiple sources, possible hypercalcemia in sensitive individuals
2022.benefits: Firming agent in canned vegetables, source of dietary calcium in small amounts

2023.name: Potassium Bicarbonate
2023.description: Potassium bicarbonate is a white, crystalline powder used as a leavening agent in baking and as a dietary potassium supplement. In the body, it acts as an electrolyte, helping to regulate acid-base balance and support normal muscle and nerve function.

sources.label: PubMed â Potassium interventions and blood pressure
NCBI Bookshelf â Potassium Bicarbonate

2023.risks: Hyperkalemia with excessive intake, possible interaction with certain medications (e.g. ACE inhibitors, potassium-sparing diuretics), may cause gastrointestinal upset at high doses
2023.benefits: Electrolyte balance, mild blood pressure support, may help prevent muscle cramps, supports acid-base balance

1946.name: Water
1946.description: Water is a colorless, tasteless, and odorless liquid essential for all forms of life, playing a vital role in hydration, cellular function, digestion, temperature regulation, and nutrient transport in the human body.

sources.label: PMC2908954 â Water, Hydration and Health
PMC6412105 â The Importance of Water and Hydration

1946.risks: Potential contamination with heavy metals, microbes, or chemicals depending on source
1946.benefits: Essential for hydration, facilitates metabolic processes, regulates body temperature, supports kidney function

592.name: L-theanine
592.description: L-theanine is an amino acid primarily found in green tea that is known for its calming effects on the nervous system and its ability to promote relaxation without sedation.

sources.label: PMC6222489 â Effects of L-theanine on cognitive function and mental health
PubMed â L-theanine and its role in stress and anxiety modulation

592.risks: Mild gastrointestinal upset, rare allergic reactions, limited safety data for pregnancy and lactation
592.benefits: Promotes relaxation, may reduce stress, may improve focus, may aid in sleep quality, potential neuroprotective effects

660.name: Reverse Osmosis Water
660.description: Reverse osmosis water is purified by forcing water through a semipermeable membrane to remove most dissolved solids, contaminants, and minerals. While efficient at removing a large spectrum of impurities, it may still contain trace contaminants and lacks essential minerals present in natural water sources.

sources.label: Reverse osmosis technology in water treatment
Potential impacts of demineralized water consumption

660.risks: May lack essential minerals, potential for trace contaminants if system maintenance is inadequate, possible changes to water taste
660.benefits: Reduces many contaminants, lowers heavy metal exposure, lessens some waterborne pathogens

682.name: Cucumber essence
682.description: Cucumber essence is a liquid extract or distillate capturing the volatile aroma compounds of cucumber, often used to impart a natural cucumber flavor in foods and beverages. It typically contains little to no nutritional value and consists mostly of water and trace flavor molecules.

sources.label: ScienceDirect â Recovery of natural flavors: solvent extraction and distillation
ACS â Aroma Extraction and Analysis in Cucumis sativus

682.risks: Lack of nutritional value, may contain trace solvents or carriers if not specified as pure distillate

2291.name: Silicon Dioxide (Silica)
2291.description: Silicon dioxide, commonly known as silica, is an inert, naturally occurring mineral compound used in foods primarily as an anti-caking agent to prevent clumping and improve flow properties in powdered products.

sources.label: PMC4997433 â Safety evaluation of silicon dioxide as a food additive
PubMed â Health effects of food-grade silica

2291.risks: Inhalation risk in occupational settings, potential for nanoparticle absorption (unproven in food-grade silica), no nutritional value

399.name: Ammonia
399.description:
Ammonia solutions (containing more than 35% but not more than 50% ammonia) appears as a clear colorless liquid consisting of ammonia dissolved in water. 
Ammonia, anhydrous appears as a clear colorless gas with a strong odor.

sources.label: Compound Summary Ammonia. National Library of Medicine

399.benefits: It is used as a flavoring agent for food additives. It is also used in cosmetic industry as buffer solution.

1055.name: Natural Spring Water
1055.description: Natural spring water is water sourced from underground formations and emerges naturally to the surface. It typically contains mineral content specific to its source and undergoes minimal processing to preserve the original mineral composition.

sources.label: PMC6836015 â Drinking water as a source of minerals
PubMed â Mineral Composition of Bottled and Tap Water

1055.risks: May contain trace minerals or contaminants, possible microbial presence if untreated, vulnerable to environmental pollution
1055.benefits: Source of hydration, contains naturally occurring minerals, generally free from added chemicals

5280.name: Carbon Dioxide
5280.description: Carbon dioxide (COâ) is a colorless, odorless gas used in the food industry primarily as a carbonation agent in beverages and as a preservative (modified atmosphere packaging). In the human body, COâ is a natural byproduct of respiration and cellular metabolism.

sources.label: NCBI Bookshelf â Carbon Dioxide Toxicity and Effects
PubMed â Role of CO2 in Food Packaging and Preservation

658.name: Celtic Sea Salt
658.description: Celtic sea salt is a mineral-rich unrefined salt harvested from coastal seawater, typically containing sodium chloride along with trace amounts of minerals like magnesium, potassium, and calcium.

sources.label: PubMed â Sea Salt vs Table Salt: Effects on Blood Pressure
PMC8420767 â Health Risks of Sodium and the Potential Role of Sea Salt

658.risks: May contribute to hypertension, risk of excess sodium intake, contains similar sodium content as table salt
658.benefits: Provides trace minerals, source of electrolytes

25.name: Dipotassium Phosphate
25.description: Dipotassium phosphate is an inorganic salt commonly used in food products as an emulsifier, stabilizer, and buffering agent. It serves various functional purposes in processed foods such as non-dairy creamers and powder mixes. The compound is recognized as Generally Recognized as Safe (GRAS) by the FDA when used in standard food applications.

sources.label: PMC9102588 â Dietary Phosphorus, Food Additives, and Health
PubMed â Phosphate food additives and public health

25.risks: May contribute to phosphate load, potential impact on kidney health with high intake, possible cardiovascular risk in excess consumption, ultra-processed additive

668.name: Monopotassium phosphate
668.description: Monopotassium phosphate (MKP) is an inorganic compound used in food and beverage processing as a buffering agent, nutrient source, and sometimes as a fertilizer. In food products, it regulates acidity and acts as a source of potassium and phosphorus.

sources.label: PMC8221182 â Dietary phosphate additives and health risks
PubMed â Safety evaluation of certain food additives (Monopotassium phosphate)

668.risks: Electrolyte imbalance with excessive intake, potential renal stress in individuals with kidney dysfunction, associated with metabolic disturbances in high-phosphate diets
668.benefits: Source of potassium, source of phosphorus

684.name: Disodium phosphate (DSP)
684.description: Disodium phosphate is an inorganic compound used as an emulsifier, stabilizer, pH buffer, and chelating agent in processed foods. It helps maintain texture and shelf life but adds inorganic phosphate to the diet.

sources.label: PMC5664031 â Effects of phosphate additives in food
PubMed â Phosphorus additives and health risks

684.risks: Excess phosphate intake, potential impact on kidney health, associated with vascular calcification, overconsumption linked to cardiovascular risk

2096.name: Natural Grapefruit Essence
2096.description: Natural grapefruit essence is typically a volatile aromatic extract obtained from the peel or juice of grapefruits, used to impart flavor and aroma to foods and beverages. It contains concentrated grapefruit-derived compounds but lacks significant nutritional value.

sources.label: PubMed â Chemical composition and antioxidant activity of grapefruit essential oils
PMC4336979 â Food flavorings and extracts: Toxicology and risk assessment

2096.risks: Potential allergen, lack of transparency in processing, may contain trace solvents or carriers, no nutritional value

616.name: Ascorbic Acid
616.description: Ascorbic acid is the chemically isolated form of vitamin C, used in foods as an antioxidant and preservative. It is essential for collagen synthesis, immune function, and acts as a free radical scavenger in the body.

sources.label: PMC6124954 â Vitamin C in health promotion
PubMed â Risks associated with high-dose ascorbic acid

616.risks: Gastrointestinal upset at high doses, kidney stone risk for susceptible individuals
616.benefits: Supports immune system, antioxidant activity, enhances iron absorption, collagen formation

662.name: Organic erythritol
662.description: Erythritol is a sugar alcohol produced via fermentation, commonly used as a low-calorie sweetener; 'organic' refers to the source material but does not change its metabolic effects or processing. Erythritol is not metabolized by most colonic bacteria and is rapidly excreted unchanged in urine.

sources.label: PMC9153481 â The effects and safety of erythritol as a sweetener
PubMed 27157012 â Erythritol: review of safety and digestive tolerance

662.risks: Gastrointestinal discomfort, potential microbiome disruption with high intake, may cause bloating or diarrhea in sensitive individuals, ultra-processed, not a source of nutrients
662.benefits: Reduced calorie content compared to sugar, does not raise blood glucose or insulin, non-cariogenic

663.name: Organic lemon juice
663.description: Organic lemon juice is the liquid extracted from certified organic lemons. It contains vitamin C, citric acid, and various phytonutrients and is used for flavor, acidity, and preservation in foods.

sources.label: PMC6204628 â Lemon and its Active Constituents as Potential Antioxidants
PubMed â Lemon juice benefits and composition

663.benefits: Source of vitamin C, antioxidant activity, contains phytonutrients, may support immune function

524.name: Organic cane sugar
524.description: Organic cane sugar is a sweetener derived from the juice of organically grown sugar cane, minimally processed to retain some natural molasses content. It is chemically similar to conventional sucrose and functions primarily as an energy source in the diet. The 'organic' designation ensures absence of synthetic pesticides or fertilizers, but the nutritional and metabolic effects are essentially identical to regular cane sugar. It is classified as Generally Recognized as Safe (GRAS) by the FDA for use in food.

sources.label: PMC5174159 â Sugar and Health: A Review of Recent Evidence
FDA â Food Additives: Sugar GRAS status

524.risks: High glycemic load, potential contribution to obesity, increased risk of type 2 diabetes with excessive intake, dental caries if consumed frequently

709.name: Watermelon Juice
709.description: Watermelon juice is the liquid extracted from the flesh of the watermelon fruit. It is naturally high in water content, contains vitamins (notably vitamin C and A), minerals, and small amounts of amino acids such as citrulline, and offers hydration and mild antioxidant benefits.

sources.label: Publication: Watermelon and citrulline health effects
ScienceDirect â Nutritional and health-promoting aspects of watermelon

709.benefits: Hydration, source of vitamin C, source of antioxidants, contains citrulline which may benefit exercise performance and vascular health

33.name: Potassium Chloride
33.description: Potassium chloride is an inorganic salt commonly used as a mineral supplement and sodium-free salt substitute in food products, as well as a preservative and flavor enhancer. In the body, it provides potassium, which is essential for proper nerve function, muscle contraction, and fluid balance.

sources.label: PMC8070865 â Potassium chloride in sodium reduction and human health
PubMed â Potassium chloride salt substitutes: clinical benefits and risks

33.risks: Hyperkalemia in susceptible individuals (renal impairment, certain medications), gastrointestinal irritation at high doses, bitter aftertaste
33.benefits: Electrolyte balance, blood pressure regulation, supports nerve and muscle function, potential sodium reduction in diets

576.name: Cassava root fiber
576.description: Cassava root fiber, often labeled as resistant dextrin or soluble tapioca fiber in processed foods, is a semi-synthetic dietary fiber derived from cassava root starch through enzymatic or chemical modification, used predominantly as a bulking agent or low-calorie filler.

sources.label: PMC8957987 â Physiological effects of resistant dextrin and synthetic fibers
PubMed â Digestive tolerance and fermentability of soluble fibers from cassava

576.risks: Potential for digestive discomfort or bloating, variations in physiological effects compared to natural fibers, limited evidence for long-term health benefits, may not provide equivalent benefits to natural dietary fibers
576.benefits: Mild support for bowel regularity, modest prebiotic activity

527.name: Organic apple cider vinegar
527.description: Apple cider vinegar is a fermented acetic acid solution derived from apples, commonly used as a food preservative, condiment, or functional ingredient. The organic designation indicates it is made from certified organic apples without synthetic pesticides or additives.

sources.label: PMC1785201 â Vinegar: Medicinal Uses and Antiglycemic Effect
PubMed â Vinegar consumption on glycemic control

527.risks: Esophageal irritation, dental enamel erosion, possible hypokalemia with excessive intake
527.benefits: Potential glycemic control, mild antimicrobial effects, appetite modulation

525.name: Organic agave inulin
525.description: Organic agave inulin is a type of soluble dietary fiber extracted from the agave plant. It acts as a prebiotic by feeding beneficial gut bacteria and is sometimes used as a low-calorie sweetener or texture enhancer in food products.

sources.label: PMC3705355 â Inulin-type fructans: functional food ingredients
PubMed â Dietary inulin and its impact on health

525.risks: Digestive discomfort, bloating, gas, diarrhea at high intakes
525.benefits: Supports beneficial gut bacteria, improves bowel regularity, may aid glucose metabolism, may help with mineral absorption

577.name: Chicory root inulin
577.description: Chicory root inulin is a naturally occurring soluble fiber extracted from the root of the chicory plant, commonly used as a prebiotic and food additive to improve texture, sweetness, and fiber content.

sources.label: PubMed â Health benefits of inulin-type prebiotics
PMC5372975 â Effects of inulin on the human gut microbiota

577.risks: Gastrointestinal discomfort,bloating,gas,possible exacerbation of IBS symptoms at high doses
577.benefits: Supports beneficial gut microbiota,improves bowel regularity,may aid in mineral absorption,may contribute to improved glycemic control

1272.name: Organic Stevia Leaf Extract
1272.description: Organic stevia leaf extract is a purified, zero-calorie sweetener derived from the Stevia rebaudiana plant. It contains steviol glycosides, primarily rebaudioside A and stevioside, which provide sweet taste without raising blood glucose.

sources.label: PMC4890837 â Stevia, natureâs zero-calorie sustainable sweetener
PubMed â Safety evaluation and pharmacological potential of steviol glycosides

1272.risks: Potential gut microbiome disruption, possible digestive discomfort in sensitive individuals, ultra-processed relative to whole stevia leaf
1272.benefits: Calorie-free sweetening, non-glycemic, may aid in glucose management

267.name: Organic Lime Juice
267.description: Organic lime juice is derived from organically grown limes and is rich in vitamin C, antioxidants, and minor phytonutrients. In the diet, it can provide immune support and aid in iron absorption. In food products, it acts as a natural acidulant and flavor enhancer.

sources.label: PubMed â Health benefits and safety of citrus fruit
PMC6124841 â Citrus fruits as a source of bioactive compounds

267.risks: Mild dental enamel erosion with excessive consumption
267.benefits: Source of vitamin C, antioxidant properties, supports iron absorption, natural flavoring

1285.name: Organic Lemon Juice Concentrate
1285.description: Organic lemon juice concentrate is made by removing water from organically grown lemon juice, resulting in a shelf-stable, potent source of natural citrus acids and phytochemicals; it is used as a flavoring, acidulant, and source of vitamin C in foods.

sources.label: PubMed â Lemon juice has protective activity in oxidative stress
PMC4997435 â Citrus flavonoids and health benefits

1285.risks: Potential dental enamel erosion due to acidity, mild digestive upset in sensitive individuals
1285.benefits: Source of vitamin C, contains antioxidants, potential antimicrobial properties

747.name: Potassium carbonate
747.description: Potassium carbonate is an inorganic salt commonly used in food processing as a pH regulator, stabilizer, and leavening agent. It helps control acidity and can affect texture and color in certain foods such as noodles, cocoa, and baked goods.

sources.label: Food Additive Safety: An Update on Potassium-Based Additives
ScienceDirect â The functional role of food additives in food systems

747.risks: May cause gastrointestinal irritation in large amounts, potential for electrolyte imbalance at very high intakes, rare allergenic reactions

70.name: Tap water
70.description: Tap water is municipal water supplied to homes and industries, typically treated for pathogens and contaminants but may still contain traces of disinfection byproducts, heavy metals, and other pollutants depending on the source and local infrastructure.

sources.label: PMC9208419 â Drinking water quality, contamination, and health risk
PubMed â Tap water as a source of chemicals and heavy metals

70.risks: Potential trace contaminants, disinfection byproducts, heavy metals, microplastics
70.benefits: Hydration, essential for life, may contain beneficial minerals

718.name: Lychee puree
718.description: Lychee puree is made from the pulp of fresh lychee fruit and is often used as a flavoring or sweetener in food products. It provides vitamin C, antioxidants, and some fiber, and is valued for its sweet, fragrant taste.

sources.label: PubMed â Nutritional and antioxidant properties of lychee
ScienceDirect â Lychee (Litchi chinensis Sonn.): Nutritional Value, Health Benefits, and Applications

718.risks: High sugar content, possible allergic reactions
718.benefits: Rich in vitamin C, contains polyphenols and antioxidants, minor fiber content

515.name: Lemon Juice (real)
515.description: Lemon juice is the liquid extracted from fresh lemons. It is a natural source of vitamin C and contains citric acid, antioxidants, and small amounts of other vitamins and minerals. Lemon juice is used for flavor enhancement and may contribute to immune support and antioxidative effects.

sources.label: PMC6262927 â Lemon and Its Active Constituents: A Review on Health Benefits
PubMed â Effects of fruit juices on dental enamel

515.risks: Tooth enamel erosion if consumed in excess, gastrointestinal discomfort in sensitive individuals
515.benefits: Rich in vitamin C, antioxidant properties, may support immune function, may aid iron absorption

653.name: Sodium hexametaphosphate
653.description: Sodium hexametaphosphate (SHMP) is a synthetic polyphosphate used as an emulsifier, sequestrant, and preservative in various processed foods to improve texture and shelf life.

sources.label: PubMed â Dietary phosphates and human health concerns
PMC5743732 â Polyphosphate additives in food and health implications

653.risks: Possible gastrointestinal irritation, excessive phosphate intake may disrupt calcium metabolism, potential kidney burden in sensitive individuals, ultra-processed additive

607.name: Acesulfame K
607.description: Acesulfame K is a calorie-free artificial sweetener commonly used in processed foods and beverages. It is approximately 200 times sweeter than sucrose and is often blended with other sweeteners to enhance flavor and stability.

sources.label: PMC9153245 â Effects of Non-nutritive Sweeteners on the Gut Microbiota
PubMed â Metabolic effects and safety concerns of acesulfame potassium

607.risks: May alter gut microbiome, possible metabolic effects, long-term safety debates, may increase sweet preference

730.name: Organic lemon flavor
730.description: Organic lemon flavor refers to a natural flavoring derived from organic lemons, typically through extraction or distillation processes, and used to impart a lemon-like taste or aroma in foods; however, it may still contain added solvents or carriers approved in organic processing.

sources.label: PubMed â Natural flavors: Regulations and composition
PMC3854496 â Safety of food flavors and flavorings

730.risks: Lack of transparency, may contain processing aids or carriers, no nutritional value, ultra-processed
